quote_first: The second hand moved relentlessly—relentlessly towards
quote_last: . He busied himself with breakfast and the morning paper. The Post informed him that many buildings had caught fire during the night in one of the worst storms in Washington’s history, and the Lubber Run in Virginia had overflowed its banks, causing heavy property damage.
title: Shall We Tell the President?
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote_first:
“Here’s your clock, Katy,” he said. “I’ve got it fixed so that it strikes all right. Only you must be careful not to hit the stiker when you start the pendulum.”
“Have you really?” said Katy. “Why, Dorry, you’re a genius! I’m ever so much obliged.”

title: What Katy Did
author: Susan Coolidge
